titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Ekaterina Nikolaevna Vagner Papers, 1876-1936
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Ekaterina Nikolaevna Vagner Papers,
did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, diaries, and printed matter, relating to revolutionary movements and events in Russia. Includes a study by N. N. Dzvonkevich (father of E. N. Vagner), entitled Reminiscences, relating to the Strelnikovskii trial in Odessa; and letters from Ekaterina Breshko-Breshkovskaia

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Ekaterina Nikolaevna Vagner Papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1937.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: Two letters (1910, 1938), of E. K. Breshkovskaiia to E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner
Manuscript of an article "Nihilism and Socialism" by N. N. Dzvonkevich, written while in exile, 1885
Notes of N. N. Dzvonkevich concerning the Kadainskii mines, where he worked during his exile in Siberia
Notes of N. N. Dzvonkevich concerning nihilism in Kiev. Written while in exile, 1885-1886
Biographical notes on N. N. Dzvonkevich
Poetry, in Ukrainian, written by N. N. Dzvonkevich, 1884-1889, while in exile
Two copies of letters from inmates of a Moscow prison, 1920
Four letters to E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner from E. E. Lazarev
One letter from the Social Revolutionary Party to the editors of the Jitsusyo-no-Nihon, Tokyo
One letter from Nina A. Struve to M. I. Pisarev, 1902
Congratulatory letter from Bolsheviks, in exile on Capri, to P. A. Kropotkin on his 70th birthday
Postcards concerning the Russian Civil War
Three letters to E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner from V. M. Chernov, leader of the Social Revolutionary Party
One letter from Herman Bernstein to the publishers of "Volia Rossii," 1921
Twenty-six letters from C. M. Oberutchev to E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner
Three letters from Polivanov to M. I. Pisarev, 1903
Correspondence file of A. Khristoforov
Notes of N. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner during the period of his departure for Serbia, 1876
Diary of N. N. Dzvonkevich, in exile, 1884-1891
Memoirs on the Strelnikovskii Trial in Odessa, written by E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner
Twelve letters of E. K. Breshkovskaia, 1910-1916
253 letters to E. N. Dzvonkevich-Wagner from N. N. Dzvonkevich, 1881-1908
Miscellaneous correspondence, manuscripts, typescripts, notes and other printed materials
